page.title: 04Fire Station, Whitfield
page.content: The fire station was opened by Right Honorable Countess of Guilford on May 18th 1960 and stands on the Sandwich Road, between the library and Beauxfield. The 'Dennis' fire engine and 16 firemen cover the area of West Langdon, Coldred, Sibertswold, Denton, Ewell Minnis, Aylesham, River and Temple Ewell. They have a telex machine in the office and each man has a pocket bleeper. It is an unmanned station. One of the firemen's full-time occupation is as a train driver and has been a fireman for 17 years. The funniest call-out was about 16 years ago at Adisham where a house and garden were under 2 feet of water. The owner of the land came towards the firemen whilst holding a sieve and bucket in his hand and asked, "Do you think you could help me rescue my goldfish?"
